basics.name: Sreejith Kesavan
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: A Polyglot Developer with a strong background in the Cloud & Virtualization domain having built products and solutions for the web hosting businesses. Currently involved in the development of various solution tools for the Networked Storage domain at NetApp.

work.summary: Working as part of a team responsible for participating in the development, testing and debugging of operating systems and file systems that run NetApp storage applications.
highlights: Currently involved in the development of an Inventory Collect Tool which enables you to collect information about 7-Mode storage systems, hosts attached to the storage systems, and the applications running on these hosts, and to create an inventory report that contains configuration and inventory information.

Involved in the development of the 7-Mode Transition Tool which enables copy-based transitions of Data ONTAP 7G and 7-Mode FlexVol volumes and configurations to new hardware that is running clustered Data ONTAP 8.2, 8.2.1, or 8.2.2, with minimum client disruption and retention of storage efficiency options.
Developed an application suite (NetApp Data Center Planner) comprising of utilities that assist in data migration.
Developed various data collection modules to collect Storage Array, Controller, Switch, Host, LUN etc. information using the NetApp Data Center Collector.
Developed a Migration Planner to generate heterogeneous SAN migration plans (LUNs from other storage vendors to NetApp storage) by analyzing the current Data Center configurations.
Developed a Transition Planner to migrate LUNs from NetApp 7-Mode systems to clustered Data ONTAP using Data Transport Appliance (DTA2800).
Effectively leading the SCRUM team into successful delivery of the project milestones.

work.summary: Actively involved in the design and development of a cloud computing platform that can solve the problems of application scalability, availability and fault-tolerance.
highlights: Lead a team of 3 developers to build a scalable platform for Python web applictions.
Helped clients to scale their applications and move towards private cloud.
Developed core services and Google App Engine compatible apis for a PaaS project.

Developed a FUSE file system to filter files from a huge collection of malware samples and make them available as a Windows Share (Samba) that can be accessed by individual Virus Analyst from their workstations.
Developed various modules and components of a Virtualization Platform targeted at VPS Hosting Providers. Supports Xen, OpenVZ and KVM Hypervisors.
HyperVM API emulation module for the Virtualization Management Platform.
Developed a Login Shell for Data Center administrators to manage the Virtual Machines remotely.
